intro: Canthium barbatum var. australense, commonly known as the Australian cock's-comb, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its distinctive, feathery inflorescence resembling a comb. The plant typically grows in coastal areas and sandy soils, thriving in well-drained conditions. Its flowers are usually pink or red, and it produces small, three-lobed berries. It is often used in ornamental horticulture due to its striking appearance and adaptability to various climates.
